title: Abiky
author: Abiky
content: Major cryptocurrencies have been on a downfall this past week, as investors lost confidence on Terra (LUNA). Bitcoin, as well as, Ethereum, Cardano, and several other "blue chip" coins are being traded at a discount these days. This could be a huge buying opportunity before prices bounce back to their original levels. If Bitcoin is predicted to reach $100k, then imagine how altcoins will rise in price. Buying the dip might be the best thing you could do right now. If you're into crypto for the long haul, you'll know what I'm talking about.That said, I'm curious to know if you're buying the dip? If so, I'd like to know which cryptocurrencies do you think are worth the investment for the long term and why? Your input will be greatly appreciated. Thanks.

comments.author: kurniawan05
comments.body: If I have excess money of course I will buy more, but unfortunately when it is bearish my money is all invested in altcoins, when there is money in the form of stable coins I will buy ETH or BNB because both coins quickly rise in price when they enter a bull run , besides that the two coins have been adopted en masse in various crypto projects.

comments.author: Marvell1
comments.body: We've just had a bad day in the markets, honestly I don't dare open my portfolio to see them I had to ignore them these days. Although I know bear season has come and will surely pass, these past few days I have also been a bit worried. Although I dared not look at my portfolio and when bitcoin dropped to 30k I bought myself some more bitcoin and bnb. Luna shocked the whole market and I dared not buy any altcoin, other than my choice of ETH and BNB, I ended up choosing BNB.

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: Now we are in a sideways market and most of the cases in bear territory, so buying should be done very carefully and also do research accurately.And if you know crypto has good fundamentals, also if you plan to go long term and buy dips in the right crypto, then there is no problem as long as you are consistent.however don't make random purchases if it is a growth crypto and so far not making real money, here the current price might be tempting but it might also drop further.in the current situation i just rely on making a dip buy in bitcoin and a bit of ethereum as both will be big coins if it goes up others will surely follow especially on bitcoin.

comments.author: cdog
comments.body: I am disappointed that my assets have decreased by more than 30% during last week's bearish, but I took advantage of the recovery stage to quickly return assets, so I have prepared a lot of USDT to buy dips during the next decline, I am very eagerly waiting for a bear market that will come because of me we have been waiting a long time since the last ATH.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: I am pretty sure quite a lot of people are buying in this dip, many people have identified severe bear periods as a time to accumulate more of their favorite coins as prices are lower, but people still have to be careful with the coins they would be accumulating this bear period, many of the coins that crashed are also pump and dump coins, many of which would not appreciate in price again, even after prices become much better. Thus any investor who buys into such projects would be at the receiving end of it all.Having said that, i believe so much in the Bitcoin system, so it is the coin i think is great to accumulate more in this dip, it is a long term project, so you do not have to worry much about short term correction periods as it will always appreciate back up. As for altcoin believers, Eth or Dogecoin is actually not a bad idea to throw some more money on.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Buying the dip would make sense nowadays but not with all your money. I would rather DCA my position in instead of throwing a lump sum. Prices are low right now but it might always go lower than this. Sooner or later the markets will go up again and when they do, you'll get mad for not buying more. It happens all the time. Buy the dip indeed but never go all in.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Yes, now imagine a situation where you buy cheap coins in the hope that they will return to their original values and they give you new lows. What do you do then? Bitcoin is predicted, it was even predicted when the price was around 40,000 and people also thought it was the bottom and there was a chance to buy cheap coins, but a couple of months passed and those bottom buyers got a new bottom. I'm not sure that right now we've peaked, the market could spin around in the 30-40,000 zone for a bit and then go down to, say, 20,000. I don't need to say that altcoins would lose even more in value from such a scenario. But still I find some prices attractive to buy, but I am afraid to buy a lot, so I would say that this situation is good for partial buying of some altcoins that you are going to buy more if the price falls even lower.
